GOD.content: Christian reversal, conversion of Platonism, entrance on scene of a “gift”  transforms Good into Goodness that forgets itself, love that renounces itself; this inaccessible source of Goodness means the donee also receives death
GOD.linkedContent: Christian reversal, conversion of Platonism, entrance on scene of a “gift” transforms Good into Goodness that forgets itself, love that renounces itself; this inaccessible source of Goodness means the donee also receives death

GOD.content: irreplaceable singularity of self [command of goodness] requires a death w/ no possible substitution “Death is mine if it is at all” [see p. 45 death creates possibility, p. 46 death is mine]
GOD.linkedContent: irreplaceable singularity of self [command of goodness] requires a death w/ no possible substitution “Death is mine if it is at all” [see p. 45 death creates possibility, p. 46 death is mine]

GOD.content: to think responsibility w/in criteria of salvation, the Good as infinite love, the gift of death, requires event of Christianity, or makes Christianity possible
GOD.linkedContent: to think responsibility w/in criteria of salvation, the Good as infinite love, the gift of death, requires event of Christianity, or makes Christianity possible

GOD.content: goodness beyond all calculation must forget itself, must be a gift renouncing itself, the movement of infinite love
GOD.linkedContent: goodness beyond all calculation must forget itself, must be a gift renouncing itself, the movement of infinite love

GOD.content: il faut un amour infini pour renoncer à soi et pour devenir fini, s’incarner pour aimer ainsi l’autre, et l’autre comme autre fini [incarnation of fire]
GOD.linkedContent: il faut un amour infini pour renoncer à soi et pour devenir fini, s’incarner pour aimer ainsi l’autre, et l’autre comme autre fini [incarnation of fire]

GOD.content: when Platonism, light or son of Good (invisible source of intelligible visibility) becomes Christian faith (a gaze)
GOD.linkedContent: when Platonism, light or son of Good (invisible source of intelligible visibility) becomes Christian faith (a gaze)

GT.content: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting
GT.linkedContent: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting

GT.content: the Good, in Republic, takes on features of father and of Capital, [Derrida’s fn references Dissemination, on bad faith of fraudulent merchandise, tampering w/ money, & on political economy] whereas Baudelaire is interested in copy of copy, phantasm
GT.linkedContent: the Good, in Republic, takes on features of father and of Capital, [Derrida’s fn references Dissemination, on bad faith of fraudulent merchandise, tampering w/ money, & on political economy] whereas Baudelaire is interested in copy of copy, phantasm

HASD.content: Being must be created by what exceeds the border, the Good, intelligible sun, something that far surpasses (hyperekhontos) [Republic 509b], excess of God, light is in Good’s image
HASD.linkedContent: Being must be created by what exceeds the border, the Good, intelligible sun, something that far surpasses (hyperekhontos) [Republic 509b], excess of God, light is in Good’s image

HASD.content: Christianity, event of event > closer to agathon than khōra
this Good inspires an entire erotics [erôs more worth of God than agapè?]
HASD.linkedContent: this Good inspires an entire erotics [erôs more worth of God than agapè?]

HASD.content: evil is even more negatively theologized than good in Pseudo-Dionysus
HASD.linkedContent: evil is even more negatively theologized than good in Pseudo-Dionysus

HASD.content: encomium is “neither true nor false, not even contradictory” [Marion] > though it says something about the thearchy, about the Good and the analogy
HASD.linkedContent: encomium is “neither true nor false, not even contradictory” [Marion] > though it says something about the thearchy, about the Good and the analogy

HASD.content: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends
HASD.linkedContent: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends

MPM.content: the coming of the impossible other, we love as such, affirming this to be good
MPM.linkedContent: the coming of the impossible other, we love as such, affirming this to be good

POOF.content: a hyperbolic build-up (surènchere) perhaps the origin of good & evil, both beyond being (Plato’s Good in Republic), a hyperbole common to both, makes them pass one into the other
POOF.linkedContent: a hyperbolic build-up (surènchere) perhaps the origin of good & evil, both beyond being (Plato’s Good in Republic), a hyperbole common to both, makes them pass one into the other

POOF.content: friendship beyond the law, justice, the political: is that the good (beyond being)? if so, should one judge/condemn one’s friend’s political faults?
POOF.linkedContent: friendship beyond the law, justice, the political: is that the good (beyond being)? if so, should one judge/condemn one’s friend’s political faults?

PP.content: son as interest on capital investment, as return, revenue, son as physical sun, analogon of intelligible sun (the Good, capital, origin of all onta); father as noooumena, son as horōmena ——meaning of patēr sometimes exclusively financial capital
PP.linkedContent: son as interest on capital investment, as return, revenue, son as physical sun, analogon of intelligible sun (the Good, capital, origin of all onta); father as noooumena, son as horōmena ——meaning of patēr sometimes exclusively financial capital

PP.content: from Lysis, good has no need of medicine
PP.linkedContent: from Lysis, good has no need of medicine

PP.content: from Phaedrus, soul-writing is good writing, is living and animate (zōnta kai empsukhon), written discourse is a ghost (eidōlon) of it
PP.linkedContent: from Phaedrus, soul-writing is good writing, is living and animate (zōnta kai empsukhon), written discourse is a ghost (eidōlon) of it

VM.content: for Levinas, sun of epekeina tes ousias (fecundity, generosity) will always illuminate inexhaustible source of thought, Plato places Good beyond Being, beyond light of Being [see p. 312n Descartes’ infinite does this too]; “ex-cendence”
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, sun of epekeina tes ousias (fecundity, generosity) will always illuminate inexhaustible source of thought, Plato places Good beyond Being, beyond light of Being [see p. 312n Descartes’ infinite does this too]; “ex-cendence”

VM.content: but isn’t Good still light of light? necessarily nocturnal source of light? heart of light is black
VM.linkedContent: but isn’t Good still light of light? necessarily nocturnal source of light? heart of light is black

TC.content: Artaud: evil is the permanent law, good a cruelty added to another cruelty > fatal limit of cruelty which begins w/ its own representation
TC.linkedContent: Artaud: evil is the permanent law, good a cruelty added to another cruelty > fatal limit of cruelty which begins w/ its own representation

FWT.content: “subject” instituted only out of “fear” of unconscious, interrupts energy; one ethical/political “system,” one “idea” of Good/Right > constructions produced to resist a threat
FWT.linkedContent: “subject” instituted only out of “fear” of unconscious, interrupts energy; one ethical/political “system,” one “idea” of Good/Right > constructions produced to resist a threat

FS.content: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure
FS.linkedContent: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure

IW.content: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]
IW.linkedContent: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]

LI.content: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)
LI.linkedContent: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)

LI.content: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)
LI.linkedContent: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)

AD.content: state, politics, ontology all betray/exceed ethics in opening it [?]: quasi-transcendental, originary, pre-originary perjury > possibility of radical perversion, haunting of its possibility, also condition of Good, Justice, Love, Faith, perfectibility
AD.linkedContent: state, politics, ontology all betray/exceed ethics in opening it [?]: quasi-transcendental, originary, pre-originary perjury > possibility of radical perversion, haunting of its possibility, also condition of Good, Justice, Love, Faith, perfectibility

AD.content: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary
AD.linkedContent: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary

WOG.content: khōra, utterly resistant to historical narrative, not eternal or ahistorical like intelligible idea > radically foreign to all oppositions & heterogenous to epekeina tēs ousias (the one that doesn’t participate in Being, gives rise to history, narratives, myths, Good and God)
WOG.linkedContent: khōra, utterly resistant to historical narrative, not eternal or ahistorical like intelligible idea > radically foreign to all oppositions & heterogenous to epekeina tēs ousias (the one that doesn’t participate in Being, gives rise to history, narratives, myths, Good and God)
